guidance_section.title: Writing Good Descriptions
guidance_section.guidance: Be specific: Instead of "a table", write "a table showing monthly expenses with columns for category, amount, and date".
Include location: "In the upper half of the page..." or "Along the right margin..."
Note relationships: "Below the main text, there is a diagram that illustrates the process described above."
Describe what you actually see, not what you assume or infer.

guidance_section.title: Handling Unclear Content
guidance_section.guidance: If image quality is poor, say so and describe what you can make out.
If content is ambiguous, describe it as you see it without guessing.
It's better to say "appears to be" than to state something uncertain as fact.

guidance_section.title: Common Content Types to Look For
guidance_section.guidance: Tables: data organized in rows and columns
Diagrams: flowcharts, process diagrams, organizational charts
Charts/Graphs: bar charts, line graphs, pie charts
